content:
From downloading Hugo to deploying to github pages. Install hugo using homebrew.
brew install hugo Download hugo theme “PaperMod”.
hugo new site (myreponame).github.io cd (myreponame).github.io git init. # init git repo. Create config.yml
PaperMod recommends using yml rather than toml. Add this line to config.yml theme: "PaperMod" Create workflow file .github/workflows/gh-pages.yml (Ref)
Push local repo to remote repo at github
git remote add origin https://github.com/(MyGitHubAccount)/(RepoName).git git branch -M main git push -u origin main The homepage will be buit & deployed with GitHub Actions. The built static webpage files will appear in gh-pages branch.
Click setting tab and move to Pages, then change the branch from which the github pages is built (main to gh-pages).
